intro: Aster decaphyllus, commonly known as the ten-leaf aster, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Aster decaphyllus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates.
